text.p: BLANTYRE - Feb 25 (Reuter) These are the leading stories in the Malawi Press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Maize yields, Malawi's stapple food, are expected to drop this year following incessant rains, but government planners say the country is assured of food security because smallholder farmers were keen to grow drought resistant crops.

- The main opposition Malawi Congress Party (MCP) Secretary General Lovemore Munlo said his party has not decided yet whether to participate in tripartite round-table talks with the ruling United Democractic Front (UDF) and fellow opposition party the Alliance For Democracy scheduled to take place this Thursday in Lilongwe.

- Government will support moves by The Law Society of Malawi to probe allegations that Chief Justice Richard Banda tried to influence a High Court Judge to rule a case in favour of government but will not be party to the investigations, Minister of Justice and Attorney General Cassim Chilumpha said on Monday.
